page.title: 11Field Sports in Shelsley
page.content: There are two main{shoots;}one run from the Manor House, Shelsley Beauchamp and the other syndicated from Brockhill Court. Competitive clay pigeon shoots are also enjoyed. There is a fair amount of poaching of game birds; rough shooting and ferreting of rabbits is much enjoyed. The{Clifton-on-Teme Hunt}have the country to the west of the river and the{Worcestershire Hunt}have the country to the east. Both countries are hunted regularly and meets on these two boundaries occur about once a fortnight in the season. There is a pack of{Mink hounds}and also{Beagles who hunt in the area occasionally. The river is fished for both game and coarse fish by members of the {White Swan Piscatorials}and the{Isaac {Walton Club.
